title: Inside the new Star Wars and Toy Story lands at Walt Disney World Resort in Florida
text:
Get the biggest Weekly Travel stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Disney's all-new Star Wars and Toy Story lands at Walt Disney World Resort in Florida are now open and there's so much to see and do.

They're the latest additions to Disney's six sensational parks and are both full of fun-filled attractions for the whole family to enjoy.

Below we've taken a look at the must-see bits from each and details everything you need to know if you're planning a visit.

And there's never been a better time to book your family holiday to Florida with free dining and park ticket offers available for selected 2020 bookings made before 5th November 2019.

To book, visit disneypackages.co.uk

Unleash your inner Luke Skywalker as you travel to a galaxy far, far away for an adventure like no other!

Disney's newest land, Star Wars: Galaxy’s Edge, transports you to the world of Black Spire Outpost on the Planet Batuu.

It boasts two new must-see attractions. The first to open in Star Wars: Galaxy’s Edge is Millennium Falcon: Smugglers Run (below) where you can blast off in the famous cockpit of the Millennium Falcon on a daring flight.

Whether you’re a pilot, engineer or gunner, every role is crucial as you take part in a very special mission.

The second thrilling new attraction to open on 5th December 2019 will be Star Wars: Rise of the Resistance (below).

Disney is promising the multi-platform attraction will be "unlike anything you’ve ever experienced at Walt Disney World Resort" and we can't wait.

The attraction sees guests buckling up to take part in a secret mission in an epic battle against the First Order, with the help of Star Wars favourites Rey, Finn, Poe Dameron and BB-8.

There are also shops full of Star Wars goodies and a cantina where you can tuck into indigenous beverages and curious concoctions from across the galaxy.

You can even sip on the blue or green milk Luke Skywalker drank in the movies (seen below) and visit Savi's Workshop to build your own lightsaber.

Another recent opening is the fun-filled Toy Story Land which is jam-packed with attractions for kids and grown-ups alike.

Join Woody, Buzz Lightyear and the rest of your favourite characters at their brand new home at Disney's Hollywood Studios.

Take a wild ride on the family-friendly coaster Slinky Dog Dash (below) that twists and turns around Andy’s oversized backyard.

Andy’s assembled his Mega Coaster Play Kit - and Slinky Dog is taking you on a wild ride as his springy coils stretch to the limit!

Guests can also go for an intergalactic spin with the adorable aliens on Alien Swirling Saucers and pop on the 4D glasses for a tour through a carnival-themed arcade in Toy Story Mania (seen below).

And keep an eye out for your favourite characters who will be waiting to meet you! Say howdy to Sheriff Woody, Yodel a hello to Jessie and greet Buzz Lightyear with your best Space Ranger salute!

Book before 5th November to dine for free

Disney’s ticket and dining offer is available to book until 5th November 2019 for selected arrivals and participating resorts 1st January - 29th March 2020 and 19th April - 3rd October 2020.

Below we've listed the full list of perks available on the book early package...

What you get in the deal...

14-Day Ticket for the price of a 7-Day Ticket

Disney's UK and Ireland exclusive Ultimate Tickets grant you unlimited access to all six Disney Parks and much more.

That means you can visit Magic Kingdom, Epcot, Disney's Hollywood Studios, Disney's Animal Kingdom Theme Park, plus the two water parks Disney's Typhoon Lagoon and Disney's Blizzard Beach as much as you like during your stay.

Also included is a Memory Maker worth $199 so you can capture your magical Walt Disney World moments with Disney PhotoPass and enjoy unlimited digital downloads.

Dine and drink for free - save £560 per adult

Enjoy self-service meals for breakfast, lunch or dinner at more than 50 locations, with healthy choices, quick eats, delicious fine dining and indulgent snacks on the menu, so even the fussy ones will be happy!

At Self-Service locations, guests order at the counter or register. Dine at great themed restaurants like Be Our Guest, Flame Tree Barbecue, Cosmic Ray's Starlight Café and many more across the resort.

At Waiter Service restaurants, guests are escorted to their table and waited on. Enjoy a range of experiences, from family casual to Character Dining (above), and Dinner Shows to the unparalleled cuisine at Disney's Signature Restaurants.

And you can also enjoy great snack options from healthy choices like fresh fruit, to treats like popcorn and ice cream too, which are available at self-service restaurants, select outdoor food carts and merchandise locations.

$100 Disney Spending Money

Enjoy a shopping spree at the Disney Store, splurge in the Parks or treat yourself at Disney Springs or at a Disney Resort Hotel!

Visit Disneypackages.co.uk for more information or to book your holiday to benefit from this offer!

* Excludes Christmas and Easter holidays. Disney's Free Dine Offer is available to book 25th April - 5th November 2019 for selected arrivals and participating resorts 1st January - 29th March 2020 and 19th April - 3rd October 2020.
description: Here's everything you need to know about these two stunning new lands
